image.altText: A woman holding the outstretched arm of a skeleton.

props.synopsis: Multiple female physiotherapists say they've experienced gender-based harassment while working for male sporting teams, often being the only woman in the change rooms.

title.children: Female physiotherapists experiencing gender-based harassment in male-dominated industry

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The first jury to deliver a majority verdict in the ACT convicts a 30-year-old Canberra public servant of sexually assaulting a colleague after a Christmas party.

title.children: Canberra public servant found guilty of sexually assaulting colleague after Christmas party

image.altText: buses in a depot

props.synopsis: The drivers' union and public transport association say they warned Transport Canberra about problems with the MyWay+ ticketing system before it was launched this week. The ACT government says those "teething problems'' are being fixed.Â

title.children: Transport Canberra was warned repeatedly about new ticketing system issues ahead of launch

image.altText: A politician cartoon showing dinosaurs arguing about nuclear and gas power.

props.synopsis: Upon being named the 2024 Political Cartoonist of the Year, Megan Herbert demanded a recount.

title.children: 'You have to be brave to do it': The best political cartoons of 2024

image.altText: An image of a middle-aged woman wearing a bright blue dress with blonde hair, standing outside near trees.

props.synopsis: Melissa Yarnold, a transgender woman, says nobody should have to go through what she experienced while in custody.

title.children: 'I was so scared': Trans woman speaks out over treatment in NSW men's prison

image.altText: A bucket is full to the brim with many dead beetles bodies.

props.synopsis: A run of hot weather is likely responsible for scarab beetles swarming some homes and business in the ACT region.

title.children: 'I thought it was raining': Swarms of beetles descend on Canberra homes

image.altText: A screenshot of a man walking in between two police officers towards a car, shot from behind.

props.synopsis: A Canberra ice-skating coach is freed on bail after police charged him with 10 sexual offences against a former student.

title.children: Canberra ice-skating coach charged with sexual offences against former student is granted bail

image.altText: A side on shot of a man wearing a black suit next to a woman in a black blazer walking looking ahead.

props.synopsis: Kristian White remains on bail, avoiding time behind bars ahead of sentencing for the manslaughter of the 95-year-old in an aged-care home.

title.children: Family of Cooma 95yo fatally tasered by cop 'struggling to understand' why he remains on bail after guilty verdict

image.altText: A soldier on a motorbike drives down a long road with houses and smoke rising at the end

props.synopsis: Syrian insurgents have taken control of parts of Aleppo, while Russian air strikes have continued to pound rebel areas, killing at least 277 people.

title.children: Syrian rebels reportedly take control of parts of Aleppo in shock offensive

image.altText: A rundown street with police tape.

props.synopsis: The bodies of a man and a woman, believed to be in their 60s, were found at a shop in Oxford Street, Cambridge Park.

title.children: Two bodies found at shop in Sydney's west following reports of assault

image.altText: Ryan Kobayashi and two women hold pictures of missing woman Hannah Kobayashi.

props.synopsis: Hannah Kobayashi vanished somewhere in LA while on her way from Hawaii to New York City, and her father died days after arriving to search for her, leading to wild theories from online sleuths as authorities continue their investigations.

title.children: Hannah Kobayashi disappeared from LAX after missing her flight. Then came a string of strange text messages

image.altText: a group exercises on bikes at a weight loss camp

props.synopsis: Beijing has launched a three-year plan to tackle obesity, with rates of overweight children and adults rapidly increasing in just a few years.

title.children: 'Really scary': Chinese obesity rates surge and expected to rival US

image.altText: A man wearing a turban.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah chief Naim Qassem has declared his organisation has scored a "divine victory" in its year-long war with Israel that paused as part of a ceasefire deal last week.

title.children: Hezbollah chief says group has scored 'divine victory' against Israel

image.altText: A woman surrounded by other pro-independence demonstrators holds up a Kanak flag behind her back.

props.synopsis: The European power spends billions of euros on New Caledonia and faces a large damage bill from this year's violent unrest. Why is it hanging on?

title.children: Why is one of Australia's closest neighbours still part of France?

image.altText: A phone screen showing social media apps.

props.synopsis: From the end of next year, children under 16 will be banned from social media in Australia. So how do parents feel about enforcing the nation's controversial new laws?

title.children: For some parents, the 'blanket rule' of Australia's under-16 social media ban can't come soon enough

image.altText: Scaffolding around the Notre Dame cathedral, backgrounded by blue sky

props.synopsis: The bells of Notre Dame are chiming again, but scaffolding still clinging to the cathedral's exterior is puzzling some Parisians.

title.children: Notre Dame is finally reopening after a devastating 2019 fire. But why does it still look unfinished?

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses leaves a court house.

props.synopsis: A family member of the victims tells a Tasmanian court: "I didn't just lose my mum and brother â¦ I lost my family unit and I lost myself. I will never be me again."

title.children: Off-duty police officer who caused crash that killed mother and son avoids jail

image.altText: A composite picture of a woman in black-and-white and a man in colour, both looking serious.

props.synopsis: The decisions the Reserve Bank makes affect the rest of us, and therefore should continue not to be taken lightly â whichever board might make them.

title.children: The struggle over Australia's economic outlook is being fought in the shadows

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood juggles a ball during first Test against India.

props.synopsis: After losing the series opener, Australia will be without Josh Hazlewood for the second Test against India in Adelaide after the experienced quick sustained a side strain.

title.children: Aussies hit with major injury blow ahead of second India Test

image.altText: A shot of a busy Melbourne street with pedestrians in front of a tram.

props.synopsis: COVID-19 cases and hospitalisations have sharply risen in Victoria, with the wave of infection concerning health professionals going into summer.

title.children: COVID-19 wave hits Victoria, prompting calls for caution ahead of festive season

image.altText: A man stands shirtless pouring 2 litres of iced coffee over his face and body

props.synopsis: A group of Gold Coast concreters have put down the tools to strip off for a lighthearted 2025 calendar, to raise funds and awareness for men's mental health.

title.children: Unlikely models strike a pose for mental health awareness calendar

image.altText: Three young women stand in front of a large tree smiling. The lady in the middle holds a baby kangaroo in a pink pouch

props.synopsis:
Regional veterinary jobs are taking more than 12 months to fill, but a Riverland clinic has found a short-term solution to boost workforce and mental health outcomes.Â 

Â

title.children: There are lots of snakes and it's 'the size of Belgium', but this region desperately needs its foreign vets

image.altText: A woman stands infront of a rose bush holding a photo of her mother and father smiling

props.synopsis: Wendy Robinson's parents were shot dead 10 years ago. She is distressed their killer is starting to get some of his freedoms back and believes he is "being treated better" than his victims' family.

title.children: Wendy's parents were murdered. She says their killer's privileges in a forensic hospital worsen her grief

image.altText: a graphic showing a male middle-aged police officer, a young man in a white collared shirt and a woman wearing a dress

props.synopsis: Every day of the coronial inquest into the death of Kumanjayi Walker, a sign reading "tell the truth" has stood outside the Alice Springs Local Court. Now, with final submissions heard, the NT coroner faces the task of finding that truth.

title.children: 'Now is the time for truth': NT coroner to deliver findings in Kumanjayi Walker inquest

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A man has died after crashing his car through the back wall of a supermarket in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man dead after car crashes through Melbourne supermarket wall

image.altText: Bushfire smoke blows behind a series of beehives.

props.synopsis: As the fight against a massive bushfire north of Perth continues, honey producers have reported devastating losses to habitat critical for their bees.

title.children: 'That is all gone now': Honey producers say WA bushfire has incinerated critical bee habitat

image.altText: A man holding a microphone in one hand eats a banana with duck-tape hanging from it in the other

props.synopsis: Justin Sun fulfilled his promise to eat the controversial artwork at a glamorous hotel in Hong Kong, describing the taste as "really quite good".

title.children: The crypto mogul who bought banana artwork Comedian for $9.5 million just ate it

image.altText: Children at a desk colouring in.

props.synopsis:
The NT opposition has criticised a government plan to direct unpaid truancy fines to be taken out of the Centrelink payments as a campaign of "fear and punishment" against parents and says the government doesn't have the jurisdiction to do it.

Â

title.children: NT minister's plan to take truancy fines from Centrelink payments branded a 'scare tactic'

image.altText: Eight books covers sit on a pale background, including Niall Williams Time of the Child and Inga Simpson's The Thinning.

props.synopsis: If you're looking to stack up your summer reading pile, here's an excellent starting point, with new releases from Rosalie Ham, Lech Blaine, Haruki Murakami and more.

title.children: Planning a summer of great reading? Here are our recommendations

image.altText: A bettong wrapped inside a cream coloured soft bag

props.synopsis: After being driven to extinction in the area, these tiny brush-tailed bettongs were reintroduced to South Australia's Yorke Peninsula as part of an ambitious project to help nature heal itself â and evidence of their eco-engineering can already be seen.

title.children: The tiny engineers helping nature heal itself

image.altText: Mr Pavel and Mr Albanese shaking hands in a room

props.synopsis: Decorated former NATO military commander Petr Pavel says democratic nations need to cooperate more in the face of threats to Taiwan, Ukraine, and global free trade.

title.children: Visiting Czech President Petr Pavel urges democratic leaders to engage more with Taiwan

image.altText: Tow children walking amid tents in Gaza, one is holding a bucket and has his hand placed on younger sibling's back.

props.synopsis: Children in war-torn areas like Sudan and Gaza are suffering more than before, a new report suggests, as grave violations against them jump to the highest level we've seen in over two decades.

title.children: Children inside Gaza wish for an 'end to the war'. But their lives are more in danger now than for decades

props.synopsis: New modelling reveals some outer reefs will stay 1 degree Celsius cooler than surrounding areas in coming decades â but it's not clear how their coral colonies will fare.

title.children: Two cool spots found in the Great Barrier Reef where corals may survive warming oceans
